messages.subject: The Mummy and the Mummy Returns
messages.msgSnippet: I mean really neat stuff.  He said that on the Mummy Returns there is even more stuff!  now I am not any more interested in seeing the movies but I DO want to
messages.messageBody:
"I mean really neat stuff. He said that on the
Mummy Returns there is even more stuff! now I am not any more
interested in seeing the movies but I DO want to see those bonus
features! How cool is that? "

I think it's really cool that you're seeing how ANY interest can lead
to learning. BUT, this is a good time for self examination too.

Why were you SO excited when you saw some schoolish form of learning
spawn off of his fascination? Why wasn't his fascination with the DVD
enough, without the Egyptology section?
Interests can lead to learning that looks like "subjects", but often
they don't. Either way, we should be excited because it's something
our children enjoy and get something from.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com
